Dorgan, Burris Jenkins Jr., Rube Goldberg, Willard Mullin, Lou Darvas, Karl Hubenthal, Tom Paprocki, Murray Olderman, Alan Maver, Lenny Hollreiser, Ray Gotto, Leo O'Mealia, Bill Gallo, Bruce Stark, John Pierotti, Bob Bowie, Bob Coyne, Bill O'Brien, Dick Dugan, Wiley Smith, Eddie Germano, Charlie McGill, Gene Basset, Stu Moldrem, Amadee (Wohlschlaeger), Bob Taylor, Lee Kavetski, Mike Luckovich, Jeff MacNelly, Pierre Bellocq, and Drew Litton. Includes photographs of most of the artists.
Cover title of this article: The Golden Age of Sports Cartooning.

34.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "Case of the Kidnapped Heiress"
34.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art

notes: Introduction of Nana Martin, and Jim Holt ; villains are a gang of kidnappers, introduced here.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

35.heading: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1.
35.title: "Cold Cures and Crime"

notes: Introduction of Dr. Lovejoy.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

36.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "The Crook Who Knew Sandman's Identity"
36.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, pencils ; Chad Grothkopf, inks and letters
36.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 56 (Nov. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: The villains Squat Stacey and his gang are all introduced.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

37.heading: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1.
37.title: "Death to the D.A."
37.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Ogden Whitney, art
37.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 48 (Mar. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains introduced: Dr. Fulton, Judge Quick, Mae Trust, and Mrs. Holt; also appearing are Dian Belmont and D.A. Belmont.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

38.heading: Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
38.title: "The Golden Gusher"
38.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art
38.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 45 (Dec. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains Gloria Gordon and Rendle are introduced ; introduction of Doug Nye and of Charley Jones, who dies.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

39.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "Island Uprising"
39.author: Bert Christman, script? ; Bert Christman, art
39.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 43 (Oct. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: A villain named Red Hatch is introduced and dies, and a girl named Australia Nelson is introduced.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

40.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "Lady in Evening Clothes"
40.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Ogden Whitney, art
40.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 47 (Feb. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Introduction of Diana Belmont, also known as Diana Ware, and District Attorney Belmont, her father. Villains are Trigger Hunt and Black Bill Trent.
Wesley Dodds is called a "steel magnate" in this story.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

41.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "The Loan Sharks"
41.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art
41.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 53 (Aug. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains Gunny, Slick Sam, and other loan sharks are introduced.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

42.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "On the Waterfront"
42.author: Bert Christman (as Larry Dean), script? ; Bert Christman, art
42.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 41 (Aug. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains are Wing and his gang, introduced here ; introduction of Janice Blue.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

43.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "Orchids of Doom"
43.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, pencils ; Chad Grothkopf, inks and letters
43.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 58 (Jan. 1941) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1.
notes: Introduction of Carla Nogades and Bill Howard ; villain Pedro Nogades is introduced.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

44.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "The Sandman Meets the Face"
44.author: Gardner Fox (as Larry Dean), script ; Fred Guardineer, art
44.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 44 (Nov. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: A villain called The Face is introduced and dies, and another called Frowser is introduced ; introduction of Billy Winnslow, who also dies.
Wes Dodds is revealed to have lived in Hilltown as a boy.
This is the first time the Sandman is in a green suit.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

45.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "The Sandman Meets with Murder"
45.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Ogden Whitney, art
45.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 46 (Jan. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: The Coin (Dudley Jones) is the villain, who is introduced and dies here ; also introduced are Charley Hall and Dora Luftus Hall (who both die) and Nora Luftus; details of the Sandman's origin are given.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

46.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "The Star of Singapore"
46.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art and letters
46.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 55 (Oct. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains Jed and Hank are both introduced here.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

47.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1 "The Story of the Flaming Ruby"
47.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, pencils ; Chad Gropthkopf, inks and letters
47.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 59 (Feb. 1941) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Henry Jenks and his gang are the villains, all introduced here.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

48.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1 "The Tarantula Strikes"
48.author: Bert Christman (as Larry Dean), script and art
48.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 40 (July 1939) ; reprinted in Justice League of America, no. 94 (Nov. 1971) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Introduction of The Sandman (Wesley Dodd or Dodds), and villain The Tarantula (Crossart).
The Sandman wears an orange business suit through issue 43.
Begins: "Extra! Vivian Dale kidnaped by"
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.
The distinctive title "Sandman Scores a Blow to Crime"* was assigned by Gene Reed in earlier indexing.

49.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "The Three Sandmen"
49.author: Bert Christman, script? ; Bert Christman, art
49.appears_in: 6 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 42 (Sept. 1939) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives v. 1.
notes: Sandman origin details given (he was in the service six years ago) ; villain Teeter Sneed is introduced and dies ; introduction of Dr. Clyde Dunlap and Happy O'Shea, who with Wes Dodds make up the "three Sandmen" ; introduction of Steve Weber.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

50.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1 "To Hammer the Earth"
50.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, pencils ; Chad Grothkopf, inks and letters
50.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 57 (Dec. 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: The villains are a mad scientist and his assistant, both introduced here ; Bill Williams is introduced and dies ; Phoebe is introduced.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

51.heading: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1.
51.title: "Tuffy and Limpy's Revenge Plot"
51.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art
51.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 50 (May 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: The villains are Toughy Tonger and Limpy, both introduced here.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes, Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

52.heading: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1.
52.title: "The Van Leew Emeralds"
52.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art
52.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 51 (June 1940) ; reprinted in Justice League of America, no. 99 (June 1972) ; reprinted (p. 107-116) in The Greatest Golden Age Stories Ever Told (New York: DC Comics, 1990) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: The villain, called Mad Maddon, is introduced and dies here. Other characters introduced are Flip Benson and his hireling, Frank Fencet. Appearance of Dian Belmont.
In the contents page of the 1990 reprint this story is assigned the title "The Pawn Broker"* ; and in earlier indexing the title "War on Crime"* was supplied by Gene Reed.
Dialogue begins: "What I want ought to be in his"
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, Bob Hughes. Craig Delich, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

53.title: Golden Age Sandman Archives ; v. 1 "Wanted! Dead or Alive"
53.author: Gardner Fox, script ; Creig Flessel, art
53.appears_in: 10 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 52 (July 1940) ; reprinted in Golden Age Sandman Archives, v. 1.
notes: Villains are Claudia Morgan and the Amber Apple Gang, all introduced here.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.
